sources.name: SEC 10-K/20-F Filings from Task 007
sources.provider: U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC EDGAR)
sources.update_frequency: annual (10-K filed within 60-90 days of fiscal year end)

data_quality.pii_details: SEC filings are public documents. May contain executive names and compensation (public information, not PII).

sha256_manifest.note: SHA256 hashes for each filing stored in separate manifest file

retention_policy.rationale: SEC filings are permanent public records. Local copies retained for research reproducibility.

usage_restrictions.note: SEC filings are public documents with no usage restrictions

limitations.geographic_coverage: Primarily US companies + foreign issuers with US listings. Does not cover companies without SEC filings.
limitations.esg_disclosure_variability: ESG disclosure in 10-K/20-F is voluntary (except climate risk per SEC rules). Some companies provide minimal ESG data.
limitations.structure_inconsistency: While SEC mandates overall structure (Item 1, 1A, 7, etc.), ESG content location varies by company.
limitations.lag: 10-K filed 60-90 days after fiscal year end. Data may be 3-6 months old at time of filing.
limitations.format_challenges: HTML format with nested tables, inconsistent styling. Requires robust parsing.

sources.name: ESG Maturity Rubric v3.0
sources.purpose: Defines 7 themes (TSP, OSP, DM, GHG, RD, EI, RMM) and stage descriptors (0-4) for maturity assessment
sources.usage: Evidence extraction patterns and stage classification logic based on rubric definitions

provenance.author: ESG Doc alignment team
provenance.validation: Aligned with ESG Doc structured maturity scoring system

sources.name: Task 007 Phase 2 Integration Test Results
sources.purpose: Provides company metadata (CIK, region, industry) for the 25 downloaded filings
sources.usage: Link extracted evidence back to company profiles and test coverage analysis

downstream_tasks: Task 009: Automated Maturity Scoring (consumes extracted evidence)
Task 010: MCP-Iceberg Integration (stores evidence in gold.esg_evidence)
